ch.njol.skript.lang

Class Effect

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.njol.skript.lang.TriggerItem
      • ch.njol.skript.lang.Statement
        • ch.njol.skript.lang.Effect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Debuggable, SyntaxElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Delay, EffBan, EffBroadcast, EffCancelEvent, EffChange, EffColorArmor, EffCommand, EffDrop, EffEnchant, EffEquip, EffExit, EffExplosion, EffFunctionCall, EffHealth, EffIgnite, EffKick, EffKill, EffLightning, EffLog, EffMessage, EffOp, EffOpenInventory, EffPoison, EffPotion, EffPush, EffPvP, EffReplace, EffReturn, EffScriptOptionLoops, EffShear, EffShoot, EffSpawn, EffTeleport, EffToggle, EffTree, EffVehicle, EffVisualEffect

    public abstract class Effect
extends Statement
    An effect which is unconditionally executed when reached, and execution will usually continue with the next item of the trigger after this effect is executed (the stop effect for example stops the trigger, i.e. nothing else will be executed after it)
    Author:
    Peter GÃ¼ttinger
    See Also:
    Skript.registerEffect(Class, String...)
